From: "Ko, Lauren" <lauren.ko@...>

Hi Enrique,
If I understand what you are generally wanting to do, you could=
 put together the full trace of URLs from "ourdomain" back to one of the se=
eds just using the crawl log.

The fourth field of a line in the crawl.log =
is the URI that was downloaded. The sixth field of the line tells you the U=
RI that referred (directly preceded) the downloaded URI given in the fourth=
 field. So generally, if you find "ourdomain" in the fourth field of a line=
, then you take the URI in the sixth field of that line and look for that a=
s a fourth field in the crawl.log, you can find its referrer and follow bac=
k in this pattern until you hit a seed URI. You should know when you get to=
 a seed URI because the sixth field will have a "-" instead of a URI (the d=
iscovery path given in the fifth field will also be a "-").

In this way yo=
u can get the particular path that this crawl instance took from the seed t=
o "ourdomain", though there may be multiple other paths existing that the c=
rawler did not take in this instance.

https://webarchive.jira.com/wiki/dis=
play/Heritrix/Logs explains the fields of the crawl.log and should be able =
to help you.

Lauren Ko
UNT Libraries
_____________________________________=
___
From: archive-crawler@yahoogroups.com [archive-crawler@yahoogroups.com]=

Sent: Monday, October 26, 2015 8:08 AM
To: archive-crawler@yahoogroups.com=

Subject: [archive-crawler] fetch the whole web trace from the starting url=
 up to a web given as parameter

Hello!


I have been working with web craw=
ler Heritrix recently in my company where i work for and after a while sear=
ching and testing it I can't find how to solve what we want to do.


We wan=
t to run heritrix automatically in cron everyday to crawl a list of webpage=
s (adult content) and what we want to do is to check if any link of that we=
bs are pointing to webs on our domains list. The difficult part and don't f=
ind the way is to log all the trace from the seed web up to that link that =
points to one our domains. I was thinking in when job finishes,  a "grep" s=
cript could check if the at least one of our domains are in the destination=
. In that case showing the whole trace


As the job's log file stores all t=
he links with some information but not the trace, and i have no idea to get=
 that info from WARC file neither.


To clarify more this, If we run a craw=
l job with seed "pornhub.com" , an example is run an script when job is don=
e to grep "ourdomain"  in the log. We don't want that "pornhub.com", has a =
banner or link pointing to our domain , so if it finds "ourdomain" in the c=
rawl log it should show as a result in another log with the whole trace fro=
m start to end:


Is it possible to do this?, or other way?. Feel very stup=
id with this stuff and i am not very good in programming

Thank you very mu=
ch in advance. Any help with this would be very appreciated

Enrique.
